info.title: Nutshell API
info.description: The most powerful API in the world

get.description:
Get an account by ID. Accounts are companies or organizations that you do business with, and are referred to as 'Companies' in the Nutshell UI.

The returned arrays creators, owners, origins, contacts, accountTypes, and industries contain additional information corresponding to the requested accounts.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: API ids are of the form 'n-accounts', where n is an integer. Ids can be listed in a comma-separated format to retrieve multiple accounts.

delete.description: Delete an account by ID. Deleted accounts are removed from the companies tab, and can be restored from the trash within 30 days of deletion via the undelete endpoint.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Ids are of the form 'n-accounts', where n is an integer.

patch.description:
Update an account by id.

op is the operation to be performed, and path specifies what resource to patch.

Use the path accounts/0/fieldName to update fields that are user-entered for this resource, i.e. name, description, etc.

Use the path accounts/0/links/fieldName to update this account's links to other resources within Nutshell, i.e. contacts, owner, territory, etc. When performing an 'add', include a /- at the end of the path, i.e. accounts/0/links/fieldName/- .

When using the remove operation, include the id at the end of the path (i.e. accounts/0/links/contacts/1-contacts) - no need to include a value.

Value can alternatively be a list of objects, which can be used with the replace operation and the path accounts/0/urls, accounts/0/addresses, accounts/0/phones, or accounts/0/phones to replace the existing list with a list of new objects. Visit the account docs for more detail on the structure of these objects.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Ids are of the form 'n-accounts', where n is an integer.

get.description: Get a list of custom field values for an account by ID. Custom fields are user-defined fields that can be added to accounts.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Ids are of the form 'n-accounts', where n is an integer.

get.summary: Get a list of custom fields
get.description: Get a list of all account custom fields in your Nutshell instance. Custom fields are user-defined fields that can be added to accounts.

post.description: Creates a custom field to use for accounts.

get.summary: Get list items for all accounts
get.description: Get a list of all accounts and associated data in your Nutshell Instance, in a list item format. List items have additional fields attached to them for filtering purposes.

parameters.name: filter[name]
parameters.description: Filter results by name. Visit the filters guide for more information on how to filter by other terms.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Used to search all related info on an entity. Returns all entities that are similar to the query term.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort the returned list by a chosen field. Use a '-' before the field name to sort in descending order.

total.description: The total number of accounts in your Nutshell instance

facets.description: Contains an AccountType object, which lists the id and count for each account type in your instance

n-accountTypes.description: The number of accounts with the account type id n-accountTypes, where n is an integer

get.description: Get all accounts and associated data in your Nutshell instance. Accounts are companies or organizations that you do business with, and are referred to as 'Companies' in the Nutshell UI.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: query for accounts associated with a specific email address

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Used to search all related info on an entity. Returns all entities that are similar to the query term.

parameters.name: filter[contacts][]
parameters.description:
Filter by accounts that have a specific contact (person) associated with them. The value should be the id of the contact, in the form 'n-contacts', where n is an integer.

Visit the filtering guide for more information on the usage of filters and the different filter terms that are available.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort the returned list by a chosen field. Use a '-' before the field name to sort in descending order.

parameters.name: page[limit]
parameters.description: Limit the number of results returned, for pagination.

parameters.name: page[page]
parameters.description: Request a specific page of results, for pagination. Used in conjunction with the page[limit] parameter. Indexing is 0-based.

total.description: The total number of accounts in your Nutshell instance

facets.description: Contains an AccountType object, which lists the id and count for each account type in your instance

n-accountTypes.description: The number of accounts with the account type id n-accountTypes, where n is an integer

post.description: Create a new account. Accounts are companies or organizations that you do business with, and are referred to as 'Companies' in the Nutshell UI.

links.description: Links to other resources within Nutshell. Key is the type of resource being linked, value is the id of that resource.

customFields.description: Custom fields to add to the Account.

requestBody.description: At least one of the following fields is required: name, phone, email, address, or url. All other fields are optional.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Ids are of the form 'n-accounts', where n is an integer.

parameters.name: filter[leadPriority][]

parameters.description: Only return flagged activities

parameters.name: filter[isImportant]
parameters.description: Only return activities marked as important

parameters.name: filter[dateMin]

parameters.description: Activity ID of the format {integer}-activities

get.description: Returns a single contact based on the provided ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Contact ID

delete.description: Deletes a contact from Nutshell. Can be recovered by posting to /contacts/{id}/undelete

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Contact ID

patch.description:
Update a contact by id.

op is the operation to be performed, and path specifies what resource to patch.

Use the path contacts/0/fieldName to update fields that are user-entered for this resource, i.e. name, description, etc.

Use the path contacts/0/links/fieldName to update this contact's links to other resources within Nutshell, i.e. accounts, owner, territory, emAudiences, etc. When performing an 'add', include a /- at the end of the path, i.e. contacts/0/links/fieldName/- .

When using the remove operation, include the id at the end of the path (i.e. contacts/0/links/accounts/1-accounts) - no need to include a value.

Value can alternatively be a list of objects, which can be used with the replace operation and the path contacts/0/urls, contacts/0/addresses, contacts/0/phones, contacts/0/phones, contacts/0/links/emAudiences, or contacts/0/links/accounts to replace the existing list with a list of new objects. For certain replace operations like accounts and emAudiences, provide an array of strings as the value.

Visit the contact docs for more detail on the structure of these objects.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Ids are of the form 'n-contacts', where n is an integer.

get.description: Returns a list of custom fields for a contact.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Contact ID

get.description: Get a list of all custom fields that can be applied to any contact.

post.description: Creates a custom field to use for contacts.

get.description: Returns a number of contacts which is filterable based on their basic information.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Returns contacts with the provided email address.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Returns contacts with a piece of information similar to the provided string, such as name, email, location, etc.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: What criteria to order the returned list of results.

parameters.name: filter[leads][]
parameters.description: Of the format '?filter[accounts][]=1-accounts,2-accounts', where 'accounts' can be any entity. See the guide on Filters for more details.

parameters.name: page[page]
parameters.description: The page of results to return

parameters.name: page[limit]
parameters.description: How many results to return per page

post.description: Create a new contact, also known as a person, in Nutshell. Only one contact may be created at a time.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Contact ID

get.description: Get a list of all contacts and associated data in your Nutshell Instance, in a list item format. List items have additional fields attached to them for filtering purposes. Contacts are people that you do business with, and are referred to as 'People' in the Nutshell UI.

parameters.name: filter[name]
parameters.description: Filter results by name. Visit the filters guide for more information on how to filter by other terms.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Used to search all related info on an entity. Returns all entities that are similar to the query term.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort the returned list by a chosen field. Use a '-' before the field name to sort in descending order.

total.description: The total number of contacts in your Nutshell instance

get.description: Retrieve a feed of events. Events, also known as change logs, are a record of everything that happened in Nutshell. They're used to power notifications and timelines among other things.

parameters.name: max_id
parameters.description: Retrieve a feed of events with an ID less than or equal to than the specified ID

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: Retrieve a feed of events with an ID greater than the specified ID

parameters.name: max_time
parameters.description: Retrieve a feed of events that occurred before the specified time

parameters.name: since_time
parameters.description: Retrieve a feed of events that occurred after the specified time

parameters.name: entity_id
parameters.description: Retrieve a feed of events related to a specific entity

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of events to return

parameters.name: events
parameters.description: Opt in to additional event types: comments, mailchimp, followup, constantContact, emailInteraction, assignments, formSubmissions

parameters.name: filters[payload][]
parameters.description: Retrieve a feed of events related to a type of entity

parameters.name: filters[creator][]
parameters.description: Retrieve a feed of events caused by a specific user or team

parameters.name: filters[emailEntityType][]
parameters.description: Whether to receive email sent or received events. Requires a creator filter

get.description: Retrieve a feed of every time an entity was deleted.

parameters.name: filter[types]
parameters.description: Retrieve a feed of events related to a type of entity

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Reverse the order of returned results

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user ID to get saved filters for

parameters.name: reportType
parameters.description: The report type to get saved filters for

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filter options

get.description: Get a single lead by the ID provided.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Lead ID

delete.description: Delete a lead by the ID provided. Can be restored with the undelete endpoint.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Lead ID

patch.description:
Update a lead by id.

op is the operation to be performed, and path specifies what resource to patch.

Use the path leads/0/fieldName to update fields that are user-entered for this resource, i.e. name, description, etc.

Use the path leads/0/links/fieldName to update this lead's links to other resources within Nutshell, i.e. contacts, owner, tags, etc. When performing an 'add', include a /- at the end of the path, i.e. leads/0/links/fieldName/- .

When using the remove operation, include the id at the end of the path (i.e. leads/0/links/contacts/1-contacts) - no need to include a value.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Lead ID

get.summary: Get list items for all leads
get.description: Get a list of all leads and associated data in your Nutshell Instance, in a list item format. List items have additional fields attached to them for filtering purposes.

parameters.description: Filter results by name. Visit the filters guide for more information on how to filter by other terms.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Used to search all related info on an entity. Returns all entities that are similar to the query term.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort the returned list by a chosen field. Use a '-' before the field name to sort in descending order.

get.description: Get a list of all leads and associated data in your Nutshell Instance.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Used to search all related info on an entity. Returns all entities that are similar to the query term.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort the returned list by a chosen field. Use a '-' before the field name to sort in descending order.

parameters.name: filter[number]
parameters.description: Of the format '?filter[number]=1000', where 'number' can be any valid filter type. See the guide on Filters for more details.

parameters.name: page[page]
parameters.description: The page of results to return

parameters.name: page[limit]
parameters.description: How many results to return per page

post.description: Create a new lead. Only one lead can be created at a time.

description.description: Description of the lead, which is also set as the name of the lead

customFields.description: Custom fields to add to the Lead.

accounts.description: This can either be the IDs of the accounts the lead should be associated with, or an account object

contacts.description: This can either be the IDs of the contacts the lead should be associated with, or a contact object

owner.description: The ID of the user the lead is assigned to

sources.description: The IDs of the sources the lead should be associated with

tags.description: The tags to attach to the lead

productMaps.description: The products to attach to the lead. You need to specify a product ID and under links to map the product to the lead. When specifying the price, quantity, or other root level productMap properties, you need to specify the type and productType as well

parameters.name: filter[name]
parameters.description: Filter results by lead name. Visit the filters guide for more information on how to filter by other terms.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Used to search all related info. Returns all reports that are similar to the query term.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort the returned list by a chosen field. Use a '-' before the field name to sort in descending order.

parameters.name: gap
parameters.description: The bucket size of the report

parameters.name: groupByField
parameters.description: The field to group leads by

parameters.name: pivotFacet
parameters.description: The facet to sort values on.

parameters.name: reportType
parameters.description: The type of report to generate.

parameters.name: segmentByField
parameters.description: Fields to segment the groupByField by.

parameters.name: useConfidence
parameters.description: When calculating lead values, use their weight confidence value or not

get.summary: Get all stages associated with lead
get.description: Get all stages associated with a lead by the ID provided, including information like amount of time spent in each stage.

stages.description: Get all stages associated with lead

post.summary: Update the status of a lead.
post.description: Update the status of a lead, for example, close a lead as won or lost. Also allows for setting the outcome of the lead, and competitor and product maps.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the lead to update the status of

outcomeId.description: ID of the outcome to set for the lead

productMaps.description: Array of product maps. You need to specify a product ID and under links to map the product to the lead. When specifying the price, quantity, or other root level productMap properties, you need to specify the type and productType as well

post.summary: Set the pipeline for a lead
post.description: Pipelines are also known as stagesets.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Lead ID

stageset.description: ID of the stageset to set

post.description: Watch/unwatch a lead to receive (or stop receiving) notifications about it. The user this change is made for is the authenticated user when making the api call.

get.description: A product map is an instance of a product attached to a lead, including quantity and custom pricing information. This endpoint returns a single mapping between a particular product and lead.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ProductMap ID

patch.description: A product map is an instance of a product attached to a lead, including quantity and custom pricing information which this endpoint allows you to modify.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ProductMap ID

delete.summary: Delete a product on a lead

get.description: A product map is an instance of a product attached to a lead, including quantity and custom pricing information. This endpoint returns all mappings between products and leads.

delete.description: Delete a source by ID. Deleted sources are removed from the sources tab, and can be restored from the trash within 30 days of deletion via the undelete endpoint.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Ids are of the form 'n-sources', where n is an integer.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Ids are of the form 'n-sources', where n is an integer.

get.description: Returns a list of all possible sources for leads in your Nutshell instance.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Query for sources that match a specific string

post.description: Create a new source for leads in your Nutshell instance. Sources are used to track how leads arrive at your website and learn about your business.

channel.description: The channel of the source. 0 = no channel, 1 = organic search, 2 = paid search, 3 = organic social, 4 = paid social, 5 = email, 6 = referrer, 7 = traditional, 8 = direct to website

get.description: Gets a list of pipelines that leads can be assigned to. Pipelines are also known as stagesets.

get.summary: Get a CSV export of lead movements through a pipeline
get.description: Get a CSV export of lead movements through a pipeline

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Stageset ID

delete.description: Delete a tag by id. Deleted tags are removed from the list of tags, and can be restored from the trash within 30 days of deletion via the undelete endpoint.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description:
id of the form n-tags, where n is an integer.

Ids can be listed in a comma-separated format to delete multiple tags at once.

get.description: Get a list of all tags in a Nutshell instance.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Used to query for tags that match a specific string

parameters.name: filter[tagType]
parameters.description: Used to get tags of a specific type

post.description: Create a tag. Tags are used to organize leads, contacts, and accounts into groups.

colorType.description: Use '1' for default, '2' for grey, '3' for red, '4' for light red, '5' for orange, '6' for light orange, '7' for yellow, '8' for light yellow, '9' for blue, '10' for light blue, '11' for green, '12' for light green, '13' for purple, '14' for light purple

tagType.description: Use '1' for leads, '2' for contacts, '3' for accounts

links.description: Array of entity IDs to link the tag to

post.description: Undelete a tag by id. Tags can be restored from the trash within 30 days of deletion.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id in the form n-tags, where n is an integer

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: User ID

accountResponse.description: A full response object for an account-related endpoint.

creators.description: An array of creators for the accounts

owners.description: An array of owners for the accounts

origins.description: An array of origins for the accounts

contacts.description: An array of contacts for the accounts

accountTypes.description: An array of account types for the accounts

industries.description: An array of industries for the accounts

note.description: An internal note about the activity
note.example: Andy was very excited about the new feature set

location.description: Where the activity will take place

isFlagged.description: Whether the activity is marked as important or not

isLogged.description: Whether the activity has occurred yet or not

isAllDay.description: Whether the activity is an all-day event

links.description: The entity IDs of activity participants

name.description: The new full name of the contact.

description.description: The new description of the contact, which appears under their name.

customFields.description: Custom fields to add to the Contact.

links.description: Enter API IDs to link to the contact.

accounts.description: Enter an array of API IDs for each account to associate with the contact. Including an empty array will clear all associated accounts.

territory.description: Enter an API ID for the territory to associate with the contact.

owner.description: Enter an API ID for the owner to associate with the contact.

tags.description: Enter an array of API IDs for each tag to associate with the contact.

emAudiences.description: Enter an array of API IDs ({id}-emAudiences) for each audience to associate with the contact.

absoluteLocalizedString.description: The value formatted as a string

body.description: The text to display on the note

links.description: The entity to attach the note to

parent.description: The entity to attach the note to

path.description: The path to the value you want to update
The path to the attribute to patch. Can be used to update custom fields as well, such as using /leads/0/{customFieldName}

value.description: The value to set, can be various types, please refer to our guide on JSON Patch for more information

description.description: A brief explanation of this entity which appears under their name.
description.example: CEO / cofounder @ Nutshell. Building growth software, wrangling beagles

id.description: The API ID of this entity, formatted {integer}-{entityType}

type.description: The type of this entity, e.g. 'contacts', 'leads'.

isEditable.description: Whether the activity can still be modified

isCancelled.description: Whether the activity occurred as planned or not

isFlagged.description: Whether the activity is marked as important or not

isLogged.description: Whether the activity has occurred yet or not

isOverdue.description: Whether the activity was supposed to be logged by now or not

isPrimary.description: Should this address be used if there are multiple

name.description: A label for the address, e.g. 'work', 'home', 'shipping'.

value.description: The geographic coordinates for the address.

locationAccuracy.description: How specific the address is. 8 is an exact street address, 1 is only a country.

address_2.description: Secondary street address, such as a suite or apartment number

isOptedOut.description: If this number has opted out of receiving SMS messages

isPrimary.description: Should this phone number be used if there are multiple

name.description: A label for the phone number, e.g. 'work', 'home', 'mobile'.

countryCode.description: Phone number prefix for calling individuals in other countries

number.description: The unformatted phone number with only digits

extension.description: An additional code to reach a specific person or department which share a number

numberFormatted.description: The phone number formatted for human readability

E164.description: The phone number formatted for international use; a common programmatic standard for working with phone numbers

countryCodeAndNumber.description: The phone number formatted for human readability with the country code

isPrimary.description: Should this URL be used if there are multiple

name.description: A label for the URL, e.g. 'LinkedIn', 'Facebook', 'personal website'.
